results.definition: the act of closing something
the last section of a communication
examples: in conclusion I want to say...

results.definition: approaching a particular destination; a coming closer; a narrowing of a gap
examples: the ship's rapid rate of closing gave them little time to avoid a collision

results.definition: termination of operations
examples: they regretted the closure of the day care center

results.definition: a concluding action
move so that an opening or passage is obstructed; make shut
examples: Close the door
shut the window

results.definition: become closed
examples: The windows closed with a loud bang

results.definition: cease to operate or cause to cease operating
examples: The owners decided to move and to close the factory
My business closes every night at 8 P.M.
close up the shop

results.definition: finish or terminate (meetings, speeches, etc.)
examples: The meeting was closed with a charge by the chairman of the board

results.definition: come to a close
examples: The concert closed with a nocturne by Chopin

results.definition: complete a business deal, negotiation, or an agreement
examples: We closed on the house on Friday
They closed the deal on the building

results.definition: be priced or listed when trading stops
examples: The stock market closed high this Friday
My new stocks closed at $59 last night

results.definition: engage at close quarters
examples: close with the enemy

results.definition: cause a window or an application to disappear on a computer desktop
change one's body stance so that the forward shoulder and foot are closer to the intended point of impact
come together, as if in an embrace
examples: Her arms closed around her long lost relative

results.definition: draw near
examples: The probe closed with the space station

results.definition: bring together all the elements or parts of
examples: Management closed ranks

results.definition: bar access to
examples: Due to the accident, the road had to be closed for several hours

results.definition: fill or stop up
examples: Can you close the cracks with caulking?

results.definition: unite or bring into contact or bring together the edges of
examples: close the circuit
close a wound
close a book
close up an umbrella

results.definition: finish a game in baseball by protecting a lead
examples: The relief pitcher closed with two runs in the second inning

results.definition: final or ending
examples: the closing stages of the election
the closing weeks of the year
the closing scene of the film
closing remarks
